metadata.title: CVE-2020-15676 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Firefox sometimes ran the onload handler for SVG elements that the DOMsanitizer decided to remove, resulting in JavaScript being executed afterpasting attacker-controlled data into a contenteditable element. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 81, Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR <78.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
